github-ssh-config.header: Setting up SSH for Github login
github-ssh-config.description:
SSH login is a crucial and commonly encountered theme in the world of software development and version control. It revolves around the process of configuring SSH (Secure Shell) keys to establish a secure and convenient method for accessing your GitHub account and repositories.
With SSH keys, developers can authenticate themselves to GitHub without relying on passwords, making the login process more secure and efficient. This theme encompasses various key aspects, including generating SSH keys, adding them to your GitHub account, and configuring your local development environment to use SSH for authentication.
github-ssh-config.create-necessary-files: First, let's create the files and directories necessary for SSH on the file system.

disclaimer.os: Keep in mind that those instructions are for GNU/Linux and Windows 10+
